H0.text: Water is the source of energy that green plants use to make food.

H1.text: Air is the source from which green plants get the energy they need to make food.

H2.text: Soil is the source from which green plants get the energy they need to make food.

H3.text: Sunlight is the energy that green plants use to make food.

A4.text: Photosynthesis converts light energy into chemical energy necessary for metabolism.

A5.text: In the light-dependent reactions, some energy is used to strip electrons from suitable substances, such as water, producing oxygen gas.
